title: Description and usage of MsBackendMgf
text: Spectra package provides central infrastructure handling Mass Spectrometry (MS) data. package supports interchangeable use different backends import MS data variety sources (mzML files). MsBackendMgf package allows import MS/MS data MGF (Mascot Generic Format) files. MsBackendMgf backend allows load represent data standard MGF files, MsBackendAnnotatedMgf backend supports import data MGF files containing also annotations individual mass peaks. vignette illustrates usage MsBackendMgf package.

title: Description and usage of MsBackendMgf
text: install package, start R enter: install package eventually missing dependencies.

what: Importing MS/MS data from MGF files
title: Description and usage of MsBackendMgf
text: MGF files store one multiple spectra, typically centroided MS level 2. short example , load MGF files provided package. next section also import data MGF file containing individual peak annotations. first load required packages define paths MGF files. MS data can accessed analyzed Spectra objects. create Spectra data MGF files. end provide file names specify use MsBackendMgf() backend source enable data import. now full access imported spectra variables list . Besides default spectra variables, msLevel, rtime, precursorMz, also additional spectra variables TITLE spectrum MGF file. default, fields MGF file mapped spectra variable names using mapping returned spectraVariableMapping() function: names character vector spectra variable names ("rtime") field MGF file contains information values ("RTINSECONDS"). Note also possible overwrite mapping (e.g. certain MGF dialects) add additional mappings. add mapping MGF field "TITLE" spectra variable called "spectrumName". can pass mapping backendInitialize() method, Spectra() constructor. can now access spectrum’s title newly created spectra variable "spectrumName": addition can also access m/z intensity values spectrum. MsBackendMgf backend allows also export data MGF format. export data temporary file. hence call export() function Spectra object specifying backend = MsBackendMgf() use backend export data. Note use custom mapping variables spectra variable "spectrumName" exported spectrums’ title. next read first lines exported file verify title exported properly. Note MsBackendMgf exports spectra variables fields mgf file. illustrate add new spectra variable object export data. can see also newly defined variable exported. Also, provide custom variable mapping time, variable "spectrumName" used spectrum’s title. Sometimes might required export spectra variables since exported fields might recognized/supported external tools. Using selectSpectraVariables() function can reduce Spectra object export contain relevant spectra variables. restrict data m/z, intensity, retention time, acquisition number, precursor m/z precursor charge export MGF file. Also, external tools don’t support "TITLE" field MGF file. disable export spectrum ID/title exportTitle = FALSE can used.
code: library(Spectra) library(MsBackendMgf)  fls <- dir(system.file("extdata", package = "MsBackendMgf"),            full.names = TRUE, pattern = "^spectra(.*).mgf$") fls ## [1] "/__w/_temp/Library/MsBackendMgf/extdata/spectra.mgf"              ## [2] "/__w/_temp/Library/MsBackendMgf/extdata/spectra2.mgf"             ## [3] "/__w/_temp/Library/MsBackendMgf/extdata/spectra3_empty_peaks.mgf" ## [4] "/__w/_temp/Library/MsBackendMgf/extdata/spectra4.mgf" sps <- Spectra(fls, source = MsBackendMgf()) ## Start data import from 4 files ... done spectraVariables(sps) ##  [1] "msLevel"                 "rtime"                   ##  [3] "acquisitionNum"          "scanIndex"               ##  [5] "dataStorage"             "dataOrigin"              ##  [7] "centroided"              "smoothed"                ##  [9] "polarity"                "precScanNum"             ## [11] "precursorMz"             "precursorIntensity"      ## [13] "precursorCharge"         "collisionEnergy"         ## [15] "isolationWindowLowerMz"  "isolationWindowTargetMz" ## [17] "isolationWindowUpperMz"  "TITLE"                   ## [19] "RAWFILE"                 "CLUSTER_ID"              ## [21] "MSLEVEL" sps$rtime ##  [1] 1028.000 1117.000 1127.000 2678.940 2373.511 2511.030       NA  162.070 ##  [9] 1028.000 1028.000 sps$TITLE ##  [1] "File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162"                                                          ##  [2] "File193 Spectrum1944 scans: 2406"                                                          ##  [3] "File193 Spectrum1968 scans: 2432"                                                          ##  [4] "mzspec:PXD004732:01650b_BC2-TUM_first_pool_53_01_01-3xHCD-1h-R2:scan:41840:WNQLQAFWGTGK/2" ##  [5] "mzspec:PXD002084:TCGA-AA-A01D-01A-23_W_VU_20121106_A0218_5I_R_FR15:scan:5209:DLTDYLMK/2"   ##  [6] "mzspec:MSV000080679:j11962_C1orf144:scan:10671:DLTDYLMK/2"                                 ##  [7] "CCMSLIB00000840351"                                                                        ##  [8] "blank_2-A,1_01_29559.812.812.1"                                                            ##  [9] "File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162"                                                          ## [10] "File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162" spectraVariableMapping(MsBackendMgf()) ##              rtime     acquisitionNum        precursorMz precursorIntensity  ##      "RTINSECONDS"            "SCANS"          "PEPMASS"       "PEPMASSINT"  ##    precursorCharge  ##           "CHARGE" map <- c(spectrumName = "TITLE", spectraVariableMapping(MsBackendMgf())) map ##       spectrumName              rtime     acquisitionNum        precursorMz  ##            "TITLE"      "RTINSECONDS"            "SCANS"          "PEPMASS"  ## precursorIntensity    precursorCharge  ##       "PEPMASSINT"           "CHARGE" sps <- Spectra(fls, source = MsBackendMgf(), mapping = map) ## Start data import from 4 files ... done sps$spectrumName ##  [1] "File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162"                                                          ##  [2] "File193 Spectrum1944 scans: 2406"                                                          ##  [3] "File193 Spectrum1968 scans: 2432"                                                          ##  [4] "mzspec:PXD004732:01650b_BC2-TUM_first_pool_53_01_01-3xHCD-1h-R2:scan:41840:WNQLQAFWGTGK/2" ##  [5] "mzspec:PXD002084:TCGA-AA-A01D-01A-23_W_VU_20121106_A0218_5I_R_FR15:scan:5209:DLTDYLMK/2"   ##  [6] "mzspec:MSV000080679:j11962_C1orf144:scan:10671:DLTDYLMK/2"                                 ##  [7] "CCMSLIB00000840351"                                                                        ##  [8] "blank_2-A,1_01_29559.812.812.1"                                                            ##  [9] "File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162"                                                          ## [10] "File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162" mz(sps) ## NumericList of length 10 ## [[1]] 102.0548 103.00494 103.03531 ... 1388.58691 1405.59729 1406.57666 ## [[2]] 101.07074 102.05486 103.00227 ... 1331.56726 1348.58496 1349.59241 ## [[3]] 102.05556 103.00014 115.05058 ... 1333.599 1334.61304 1335.64368 ## [[4]] 101.07122 109.68925 115.86999 120.0811 ... 1260.6073 1261.614 1272.6572 ## [[5]] 130.164459228516 144.150299072266 ... 1019.23852539062 1020.52404785156 ## [[6]] 110.070594787598 120.080627441406 ... 887.756652832031 998.447387695312 ## [[7]] 51.022404 57.033543 57.060638 ... 636.130188 660.481445 753.358521 ## [[8]] numeric(0) ## [[9]] 102.0548 103.00494 103.03531 ... 1388.58691 1405.59729 1406.57666 ## [[10]] 102.0548 103.00494 103.03531 ... 1388.58691 1405.59729 1406.57666 intensity(sps) ## NumericList of length 10 ## [[1]] 753.738 385.376 315.441 413.206 ... 3038.73 2016.43 1146.04 704.175 ## [[2]] 1228.93 1424.66 1550.9 1455.45 ... 7380.41 4960.92 5743.83 1780.76 ## [[3]] 1340.44 1714.76 1938.82 1450.36 2019 ... 5323.02 2265.43 4768.14 1532.12 ## [[4]] 81011.57 4123.349 4006.9321 66933.17 ... 22042.248 18096.48 12666.438 ## [[5]] 14.1766004562378 18.5806427001953 ... 22.7096385955811 14.864013671875 ## [[6]] 1748.57495117188 8689.9951171875 ... 2907.08422851562 2663.30908203125 ## [[7]] 65.219513 178.758606 13.01786 119.898499 ... 22.05921 30.57095 14.11111 ## [[8]] numeric(0) ## [[9]] 753.738 385.376 315.441 413.206 ... 3038.73 2016.43 1146.04 704.175 ## [[10]] 753.738 385.376 315.441 413.206 ... 3038.73 2016.43 1146.04 704.175 fl <- tempfile() export(sps, backend = MsBackendMgf(), file = fl, mapping = map) readLines(fl)[1:12] ##  [1] "BEGIN IONS"                             ##  [2] "msLevel=2"                              ##  [3] "RTINSECONDS=1028"                       ##  [4] "SCANS=2162"                             ##  [5] "centroided=TRUE"                        ##  [6] "PEPMASS=816.33826"                      ##  [7] "CHARGE=2+"                              ##  [8] "TITLE=File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162" ##  [9] "102.0548 753.738"                       ## [10] "103.00494 385.376"                      ## [11] "103.03531 315.441"                      ## [12] "115.05001 413.206" sps$new_variable <- "A" export(sps, backend = MsBackendMgf(), file = fl) readLines(fl)[1:12] ##  [1] "BEGIN IONS"                                    ##  [2] "TITLE=msLevel 2; retentionTime ; scanNum "     ##  [3] "msLevel=2"                                     ##  [4] "RTINSECONDS=1028"                              ##  [5] "SCANS=2162"                                    ##  [6] "centroided=TRUE"                               ##  [7] "PEPMASS=816.33826"                             ##  [8] "CHARGE=2+"                                     ##  [9] "spectrumName=File193 Spectrum1719 scans: 2162" ## [10] "new_variable=A"                                ## [11] "102.0548 753.738"                              ## [12] "103.00494 385.376" sps_ex <- selectSpectraVariables(sps, c("mz", "intensity", "rtime",                                         "acquisitionNum", "precursorMz",                                         "precursorCharge")) export(sps_ex, backend = MsBackendMgf(), file = fl, exportTitle = FALSE) readLines(fl)[1:12] ##  [1] "BEGIN IONS"        "RTINSECONDS=1028"  "SCANS=2162"        ##  [4] "PEPMASS=816.33826" "CHARGE=2+"         "102.0548 753.738"  ##  [7] "103.00494 385.376" "103.03531 315.441" "115.05001 413.206" ## [10] "115.08686 588.273" "120.08063 800.016" "124.10555 526.761"

previous_headings: Importing MS/MS data from MGF files
title: Description and usage of MsBackendMgf
text: Variants MGF files can also contain annotations individual mass peaks. files expected contain one line per mass peak, first two elements mass peak’s m/z intensity values. (eventually present) additional elements considered annotations. MsBackendAnnotatedMgf backend can used import represent files. read first 10 lines example annotated MGF file. last 3 displayed lines show mass peak content MGF spectrum m/z, intensity annotation mass peak. data files can imported using MsBackendAnntotatedMgf backend: peaks annotation also imported available additional peaks variables: names annotations follow standard R convention naming columns data.frame name provided, .e. consists "V" followed number. data can retrieved peaksData() function specifying names peaks variables extract. provided, peakData() extract m/z intensity values. Thus, call peaksData() providing names requested variables (columns). peaks data one spectrum now represented data.frame:
code: fl <- dir(system.file("extdata", package = "MsBackendMgf"),           pattern = "fiora", full.names = TRUE) readLines(fl, 10) ##  [1] "BEGIN IONS"                                                                                                                 ##  [2] "TITLE=PC(PGF1alpha/22:6(4Z,7Z,10Z,13Z,16Z,19Z))"                                                                            ##  [3] "SMILES=CCCCCC@@HO"                                                                                                          ##  [4] "PRECURSORTYPE=[M+H]+"                                                                                                       ##  [5] "COLLISIONENERGY=10.0"                                                                                                       ##  [6] "INSTRUMENTTYPE=HCD"                                                                                                         ##  [7] "COMMENT=\"In silico generated spectrum by Fiora OS v0.1.0\""                                                                ##  [8] "906.5854755900899 0.24612045288085938 CC/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\CCC(=O)OC@HCOP(=O)([O-])OCCN+(C)C//[M+H]+" ##  [9] "57.06987670808999 0.0012485487386584282 CCCC//[M-H]+"                                                                       ## [10] "71.08552677208999 0.0015523125184699893 CCCCC//[M-H]+" sps_ann <- Spectra(fl, source = MsBackendAnnotatedMgf()) ## Start data import from 1 files ... done sps_ann ## MSn data (Spectra) with 1 spectra in a MsBackendAnnotatedMgf backend: ##     msLevel     rtime scanIndex ##   <integer> <numeric> <integer> ## 1         2        NA        NA ##  ... 23 more variables/columns. peaksVariables(sps_ann) ## [1] "mz"        "intensity" "V1" pd <- peaksData(sps_ann, columns = c("mz", "intensity", "V1")) pd[[1L]] |>     head() ##         mz   intensity ## 1 15.99546 0.004359378 ## 2 19.01784 0.009557842 ## 3 53.03858 0.001721356 ## 4 55.05423 0.002519508 ## 5 57.06988 0.001248549 ## 6 57.06988 0.002908136 ##                                                                                     V1 ## 1 CC/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\CCC(=O)OC@HCOP(=O)([O-])OCCN+(C)C//[M+H]+ ## 2                                                                         CCCC//[M-H]+ ## 3                                                                        CCCCC//[M-H]+ ## 4                                                                   CCCCC[CH]O//[M-H]+ ## 5                                                   C=C[C@@h]1C@@HC@@HC[C@H]1O//[M-H]+ ## 6   CC/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\CCC(=O)OC@HCOP(=O)([O-])OCCN+(C)C//[M]+

title: Description and usage of MsBackendMgf
text: MsBackendMgf package supports parallel processing data import. Parallel processing can enabled providing parallel processing setup backendInitialize() function (readMgf() function) BPPARAM parameter. default (BPPARAM = SerialParam()) parallel processing disabled. enabled, data import performed single file, extraction spectra information imported MGF file performed parallel. data imported multiple files, import performed parallel per-file basis (.e. parallel different files). Generally, performance gain parallel processing moderate suggested large number files need processed, MGF file large (e.g. containing 100,000 spectra).

what: Mass Spectrometry Data Backend for Mascot Generic Format (mgf) Files
title: Mass Spectrometry Data Backend for Mascot Generic Format (mgf) Files
text: MsBackendMgf package provides functionality import handle MS/MS spectrum data Mascot Generic Format (mgf) files. package defines MsBackendMgf backend can used import use MS2 spectrum data mgf files Spectra R package. information see package homepage.

title: Mass Spectrometry Data Backend for Mascot Generic Format (mgf) Files

title: Mass Spectrometry Data Backend for Mascot Generic Format (mgf) Files
text: Contributions highly welcome follow contribution guidelines. Also, please check coding style guidelines RforMassSpectrometry vignette.

what: MS data backend for MGF files — MsBackendMgf
title: MS data backend for MGF files — MsBackendMgf
text: MsBackendMgf class supports import export MS/MS spectra data /files Mascot Generic Format (mgf) files. initial import, full MS data kept memory. MsBackendMgf extends Spectra::MsBackendDataFrame() backend directly supports thus Spectra::applyProcessing() function make data manipulations persistent. MsBackendAnnotatedMgf class supports import data MGF files provide, addition m/z intensity values, also additional annotations/metadata mass peak. MGF files expected line contains information single mass peak, separated white space (blank). first two elements expected peak's m/z intensity values, additional element considered annotation specific peak. See examples format supported MGF file. backendInitialize() method MsBackendAnnotatedMgf support parameter nlines. Also, import data can considerably slower compared standard MsBackendMgf backend, additionally required parsing peak annotations. Peaks information MGF files named, thus, additional peaks annotations named using standard naming convention column named data frames: first peaks annotation called "V1", second (available) "V2" . New objects created MsBackendMgf() MsBackendAnnotatedMgf() function. backendInitialize() method subsequently called initialize object import MS/MS data (one ) MGF files. MsBackendMgf backend provides export method allows export data Spectra object (parameter x) file mgf format. See package vignette details examples. Default mappings fields MGF file spectra variable names provided spectraVariableMapping() function. function returns named character vector names spectra variable names values respective field names MGF files. named character vector submitted import export function parameter mapping. also possible pass mappings (e.g. special MGF dialects) mapping parameter.

title: MS data backend for MGF files — MsBackendMgf
code: # S4 method for class 'MsBackendMgf' backendInitialize(   object,   files,   mapping = spectraVariableMapping(object),   nlines = -1L,   ...,   BPPARAM = SerialParam() )  MsBackendMgf()  # S4 method for class 'MsBackendMgf' spectraVariableMapping(object, format = c("mgf"))  # S4 method for class 'MsBackendMgf' export(   object,   x,   file = tempfile(),   mapping = spectraVariableMapping(object),   exportTitle = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'MsBackendAnnotatedMgf' backendInitialize(   object,   files,   mapping = spectraVariableMapping(object),   ...,   BPPARAM = SerialParam() )  MsBackendAnnotatedMgf()

title: MS data backend for MGF files — MsBackendMgf
text: object Instance MsBackendMgf class. files character (full) file name(s) mgf file(s) MS/MS data imported. mapping backendInitialize() export: named character vector allowing specify fields MGF file renamed. Names supposed spectra variable name values vector field names MGF file. See output spectraVariableMapping() expected format examples description details. nlines backendInitialize() MsBackendMgf: integer(1) defining number lines imported processed MGF file(s). default (nlines = -1L) full file imported processed . set positive integer, data imported processed chunk-wise using readMgfSplit(). ... Currently ignored. BPPARAM Parameter object defining parallel processing setup. parallel processing enabled (BPPARAM different SerialParam(), default) length files larger one, import performed parallel per-file basis. data imported single file (.e., length files one), parsing imported file performed parallel. See also BiocParallel::SerialParam() information available parallel processing setup options. format spectraVariableMapping(): character(1) defining format used. Currently format = "mgf" supported. x export(): instance Spectra::Spectra() class data exported. file character(1) (full) file name data exported. exportTitle logical(1) whether TITLE field included exported MGF file. TRUE (default) spectraVariable called "TITLE" used, variable present either spectraNames(object) used , empty, title generated including MS level, retention time acquisition number spectrum.

title: Reading MGF files — readMgf
text: readMgf() function imports data file MGF format reading specified fields returning data S4Vectors::DataFrame(). large MGF files readMgfSplit() function might used instead. contrast readMgf() functions, readMgfSplit() reads nlines lines MGF file reducing thus memory demand (cost lower performance, compared readMgf()).

title: Reading MGF files — readMgf
code: readMgf(   f,   msLevel = 2L,   mapping = spectraVariableMapping(MsBackendMgf()),   annotated = FALSE,   ...,   BPPARAM = SerialParam() )  readMgfSplit(   f,   msLevel = 2L,   mapping = spectraVariableMapping(MsBackendMgf()),   nlines = 1e+05,   BPPARAM = SerialParam(),   ... )

title: Reading MGF files — readMgf
text: f character(1) path mgf file. msLevel numeric(1) MS level. Default 2. mapping named character vector rename mgf fields spectra variables. annotated readMgf(): logical(1) whether MGF file contains additional peak annotations. See examples documentation MsBackendAnnotatedMgf() information expected format. ... Additional parameters, currently ignored. BPPARAM parallel processing setup used. parsing imported MGF file performed parallel. nlines readMgfSplit(): integer(1) number lines imported parsed iteration.

title: Reading MGF files — readMgf
text: DataFrame row containing data one spectrum MGF file. m/z intensity values available columns "mz" "intensity" list representation. readMgf() annotated = TRUE also peaks annotation columns (named "V1", etc) provided list representation, lengths elements matching "mz""intensity"`.

title: Reading MGF files — readMgf
text: Laurent Gatto, Johannes Rainer, Sebastian Gibb, Corey Broeckling

title: Reading MGF files — readMgf
code: fls <- dir(system.file("extdata", package = "MsBackendMgf"),     full.names = TRUE, pattern = "mgf$")[1L]  readMgf(fls) #> DataFrame with 3 rows and 10 columns #>                    TITLE precursorMz precursorCharge     rtime acquisitionNum #>              <character>   <numeric>       <integer> <numeric>      <integer> #> 1 File193 Spectrum1719..     816.338               2      1028           2162 #> 2 File193 Spectrum1944..     787.828               2      1117           2406 #> 3 File193 Spectrum1968..     780.840               2      1127           2432 #>   precursorIntensity                          mz                   intensity #>            <numeric>               <NumericList>               <NumericList> #> 1                 NA 102.055,103.005,103.035,... 753.738,385.376,315.441,... #> 2             880650 101.071,102.055,103.002,... 1228.93,1424.66,1550.90,... #> 3            1265631 102.056,103.000,115.051,... 1340.44,1714.76,1938.82,... #>               dataOrigin   msLevel #>              <character> <integer> #> 1 /__w/_temp/Library/M..         2 #> 2 /__w/_temp/Library/M..         2 #> 3 /__w/_temp/Library/M..         2  ## Annotated MGF fl <- system.file("extdata", "xfiora.mgf", package = "MsBackendMgf") res <- readMgf(fl, annotated = TRUE) colnames(res) #>  [1] "TITLE"              "SMILES"             "PRECURSORTYPE"      #>  [4] "COLLISIONENERGY"    "INSTRUMENTTYPE"     "COMMENT"            #>  [7] "precursorMz"        "precursorIntensity" "mz"                 #> [10] "intensity"          "V1"                 "dataOrigin"         #> [13] "msLevel"            res$V1 #> [[1]] #>  [1] "CC/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\C/C=C\\CCC(=O)OC@HCOP(=O)([O-])OCCN+(C)C//[M+H]+"                #>  [2] "CCCC//[M-H]+"                                                                                        #>  [3] "CCCCC//[M-H]+"                                                                                       #>  [4] title: MsBackendMgf 1.15
text: Add support peak annotations MGF files.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.15
text: Fix missing links documentation.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.15
text: Complete unit test coverage.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.11
text: Import generic methods ProtGenerics. Requires ProtGenerics version 1.35.3.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.11
text: Small runtime improvements MGF importer.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.11
text: Bioconductor 3.19 developmental branch.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.7
text: Support import MS levels MGF files.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.7
text: Fix bug import m/z values sorted.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.7
text: Enforce m/z values increasingly ordered importing.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.7
text: Run full unit test suite Spectra package check validity MsBackendMgf.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.7
text: Use compress = FALSE NumericList.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.7
text: Bioconductor 3.17 developmental branch.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.5
text: Fix export method fail one columns contain either S4 classes list-like structures.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.3
text: Import coreSpectraVariables Spectra.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.3
text: Adapt spectraVariableMapping Spectra version >= 1.5.8.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.3
text: Run additional unit test suits defined Spectra.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.1
text: Fix issue MGF files lacking peak data.

title: MsBackendMgf 1.1
text: Export precursor charge expected format (issue #16).

title: MsBackendMgf 1.1
text: Add example vignette describing export selected spectra variables MGF file.

title: MsBackendMgf 0.99
text: Export readMgf function.

title: MsBackendMgf 0.99
text: Update installation description vignette.

title: MsBackendMgf 0.99
text: Directly call internal function MsBackendMgf avoid parallel processing error (function found) Windows.

title: MsBackendMgf 0.2
text: Add examples use MsBackendMgf backend export data mgf files (issue #4.

title: MsBackendMgf 0.2
text: Add export method support exporting data Spectra object mgf file format. Import fields MGF file. Rename MGF field names spectra variables based spectraVariableMapping. Support MGF files different field names.
